bibl.title: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1941

div1.p: Ireland thanks Hench for the reprints of his yellow fever article and reports that Truby's manuscript should be ready to publish soon.

div1.head: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Philip Showalter Hench, November 26, 1941

opener.dateline:
1870 Wyoming Ave.,
Washington, D.C.,
November 26, 1941 Doctor Philip S. Hench,
The Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.

div1.p:
Thank you so much for your letter of Novem-
ber 17th. The reprints came yesterday and I am very
grateful to you. They certainly are nicely bound for
presentation. I am meeting two medical groups today--
in fact, three--and will see that each member has a
copy.

I am glad General Truby's manuscript is
getting in shape and hope that he will have some one
to print it very soon. I think it is beautifully
written and will be very, very popular.

I spend last Saturday evening with the Keans.
They are well and very happy.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely, M. W. Ireland
Major General, U.S. Army,
Retired. *ML
